cards.flavor:
"This is the light of Avacyn. Even in her absence she offers us hope."
—Radulf, priest of Avacyn
cards.name: Archangel's Light
cards.text: You gain 2 life for each card in your graveyard, then shuffle your graveyard into your library.

cards.flavor:
"It may not look like much, but it's a good old door with strong wards. It'll hold."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk
cards.name: Bar the Door
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Break of Day
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, those creatures gain indestructible until end of turn. (Damage and effects that say "destroy" don't destroy them.)

cards.flavor:
"Grab an axe and defend the gate! Your despair is an extravagance we can ill afford."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Burden of Guilt
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}: Tap enchanted creature.

cards.flavor:
"I do believe your heresy will prove more difficult now that you have more pressing concerns."
—Bishop Argust
cards.name: Curse of Exhaustion
cards.text:
Enchant player
Enchanted player can't cast more than one spell each turn.

cards.flavor: "It will take more than steel alone to purge this world of evil."
cards.name: Elgaud Inquisitor
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
When Elgaud Inquisitor dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Faith's Shield
cards.text:
Target permanent you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, instead you and each permanent you control gain protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: In the memories of those they lost lies the strength needed to defend their city.
cards.name: Gather the Townsfolk
cards.text:
Put two 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, put five of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.

cards.flavor: "I wish my work could shelter everyone, yet I pray we are never so few that it does."
cards.name: Gavony Ironwright
cards.text: Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +1/+4.

cards.flavor: Some spirits mourn. Others terrorize.
cards.name: Hollowhenge Spirit
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying
When Hollowhenge Spirit enters the battlefield, remove target attacking or blocking creature from combat.

cards.name: Increasing Devotion
cards.text:
Put five 1/1 white Human creature tokens onto the battlefield. If Increasing Devotion was cast from a graveyard, put ten of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.
Flashback {7}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: The murdered inhabitants of Hollowhenge impart to the living the terror they felt in death.
cards.name: Lingering Souls
cards.text:
Put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Flashback {1}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"I trust myself to do my duty, even unto death. It's what comes after that I'm afraid of."
—Constable Visil, to Thalia
cards.name: Loyal Cathar
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Loyal Cathar dies, return it to the battlefield transformed under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"Just fight without fear. Your soul is protected by the hand of Avacyn and will never submit to evil."
—Thalia, to Constable Visil
cards.name: Unhallowed Cathar
cards.text: Unhallowed Cathar can't block.

cards.flavor:
"When you're on watch, no noise is harmless and no shadow can be ignored."
—Olgard of the Skiltfolk
cards.name: Midnight Guard
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, untap Midnight Guard.

cards.flavor:
"Not even a roaring fire could thaw the chill it put in my heart."
—Vonn, geist-trapper
cards.name: Niblis of the Mist
cards.text:
Flying
When Niblis of the Mist enters the battlefield, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor:
"I never had the nerve to open that bottle. I'll bet you're wishing right now you hadn't been so curious yourself."
—Old Rutstein
cards.name: Niblis of the Urn
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Niblis of the Urn attacks, you may tap target creature.

cards.flavor:
"May angels carry him into the Blessed Sleep with dreams of sunlit days and moonless nights."
—Tomb inscription of Saint Raban
cards.name: Ray of Revelation
cards.text:
Destroy target enchantment.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: When angels despair, what hope can remain for mortals?
cards.name: Requiem Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever another non-Spirit creature you control dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Cats prowl the corridors of Avacyn's churches in search of devils or signs of their mischief.
cards.name: Sanctuary Cat
Séance
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you may exile target creature card from your graveyard. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card except it's a Spirit in addition to its other types. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: It patrols the grafs for miles around Thraben, ensuring that the unhallowed do not wake for long.
cards.name: Silverclaw Griffin
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.flavor:
"Valor is a currency of the living that serves us well."
—Cosper Lowe of the Silbern Guard
cards.name: Skillful Lunge
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Sudden Disappearance
cards.text: Exile all nonland permanents target player controls. Return the exiled cards to the battlefield under their owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: "Thraben is our home and I will not see it fall to this unhallowed horde."
cards.name: Thalia, Guardian of Thraben
cards.text:
First strike
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.

cards.flavor: "Swarms of the unhallowed claw at Thraben's gates! Do you still deny the end approaches?"
cards.name: Thraben Doomsayer
cards.text:
{T}: Put a 1/1 white Human creature token onto the battlefield.
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control get +2/+2.

cards.flavor: "Let them decry me for burning the dead. I'm not giving those ghoulcallers any more fuel for their madness."
cards.name: Thraben Heretic
cards.text: {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard.

cards.flavor: Those who know the alleys and sewers of the Erdwal can disappear like smoke.
cards.name: Artful Dodge
cards.text:
Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
Flashback {U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: "Come, let me free you of the tyranny of thought."
cards.name: Beguiler of Wills
cards.text: {T}: Gain control of target creature with power less than or equal to the number of creatures you control.

cards.flavor:
"I can think of worse ways to go. On second thought, maybe not."
—Ludevic, necro-alchemist
cards.name: Bone to Ash
cards.text:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Call to the Kindred
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may look at the top five cards of your library. If you do, you may put a creature card that shares a creature type with enchanted creature from among them onto the battlefield, then you put the rest of those cards on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: The skifsang, seafarers of Nephalia, craft spells like other sailors craft nets—making them strong enough to snare even the deadliest catch.
cards.name: Chant of the Skifsang
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -13/-0.

cards.flavor: "Wait . . . did you fellows hear something?"
cards.name: Chill of Foreboding
cards.text:
Each player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Flashback {7}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: "Pathetic. Let me show you how it's done."
cards.name: Counterlash
cards.text: Counter target spell. You may cast a nonland card in your hand that shares a card type with that spell without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Curse of Echoes
cards.text:
Enchant player
Whenever enchanted player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player may copy that spell and may choose new targets for the copy he or she controls.

cards.flavor: Even the House of Galan, who takes the most scholarly approach to the mystic traditions, has resorted to exploring more primitive methods in Avacyn's absence.
cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Dungeon Geists
cards.text:
Flying
When Dungeon Geists enters the battlefield, tap target creature an opponent controls. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as you control Dungeon Geists.

cards.name: Geralf's Mindcrusher
cards.text:
When Geralf's Mindcrusher enters the battlefield, target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Beware the seagrafs just off the shore. These waters are filled with hungry geists looking for an easy meal."
—Captain Eberhart
cards.name: Griptide
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: "So many corpses, so little time."
cards.name: Havengul Runebinder
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}, Exile a creature card from your graveyard: Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield, then put a +1/+1 counter on each Zombie creature you control.

cards.flavor: A head is a needless encumbrance when muscle is all that's required.
cards.name: Headless Skaab
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Headless Skaab, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Headless Skaab enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Increasing Confusion
cards.text:
Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If Increasing Confusion was cast from a graveyard, that player puts twice that many cards into his or her graveyard instead.
Flashback {X}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Mystic Retrieval
cards.text:
Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
"Keep one eye on the cliff road or you may fall to your death. Keep one eye on the sky or your death may fall on you."
—Manfried Ulmach, Elgaud Master-at-Arms
cards.name: Nephalia Seakite
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying

cards.flavor:
"Why do the dead remain among us? Where is Flight Alabaster to lead them home? Where is Avacyn?"
—Eruth of Lambholt
cards.name: Niblis of the Breath
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Relentless Skaabs
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Relentless Skaabs, exile a creature card from your graveyard.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Nothing's more valuable than perfect timing.
cards.name: Saving Grasp
cards.text:
Return target creature you own to your hand.
Flashback {W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Its screeching is the sound of you losing your mind.
cards.name: Screeching Skaab
cards.text: When Screeching Skaab enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"The veil between the living and the dead is so very thin that the whispers of the ancients can finally be heard."
—Amalric of Midvast Hall
cards.name: Secrets of the Dead
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Wounds of the flesh are easy to heal. Wounds of the mind may never be undone.
cards.name: Shriekgeist
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shriekgeist deals combat damage to a player, that player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Soul Seizer
cards.text:
Flying
When Soul Seizer deals combat damage to a player, you may transform it. If you do, attach it to target creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: The body often twists and flails spasmodically as the spirit explores its new home.
cards.name: Ghastly Haunting
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Stormbound Geist
cards.text:
Flying
Stormbound Geist can block only creatures with flying.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"As you inject the viscus vitae into the brain stem, don't let the spastic moaning bother you. It will soon become music to your ears."
—Stitcher Geralf
cards.name: Thought Scour
cards.text:
Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Jenrik's tower is served by those who once sought to enter it uninvited.
cards.name: Tower Geist
cards.text:
Flying
When Tower Geist enters the battlefield, look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.flavor: Its last life is spent tormenting your dreams.
cards.name: Black Cat
cards.text: When Black Cat dies, target opponent discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: "I have been found worthy by this great house . . ."
cards.name: Chosen of Markov
cards.text: {T}, Tap an untapped Vampire you control: Transform Chosen of Markov.

cards.flavor: ". . . and for that I shall be eternally grateful."
cards.name: Markov's Servant
Curse of Misfortunes
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a Curse card that doesn't have the same name as a Curse attached to enchanted player, put it onto the battlefield attached to that player, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"May you drink until you drown but never be sated."
—Odila, witch of Morkrut
cards.name: Curse of Thirst
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of Thirst deals damage to that player equal to the number of Curses attached to him or her.

cards.flavor: What could be more irresistible than death?
cards.name: Deadly Allure
cards.text:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn and must be blocked this turn if able.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: The faint smell of cloves, the rustling of the wind, and a paralyzing descent into an airless, fathomless tomb.
cards.name: Death's Caress
cards.text: Destroy target creature. If that creature was a Human, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.flavor: "There was a time when our cages rang with wailing. Now only a handful of these whimpering fools remain."
cards.name: Falkenrath Torturer
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Torturer gains flying until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Torturer.

cards.flavor:
"Here are some bones for you to choke on, dear brother!"
—Gisa, to Geralf
cards.name: Farbog Boneflinger
cards.text: When Farbog Boneflinger enters the battlefield, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fiend of the Shadows
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Fiend of the Shadows deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles a card from his or her hand. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled.
Sacrifice a Human: Regenerate Fiend of the Shadows.

cards.name: Geralf's Messenger
cards.text:
Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield tapped.
When Geralf's Messenger enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Innistrad's ghoulcallers are talented enough, but let me show you what someone with real power can create."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Gravecrawler
cards.text:
Gravecrawler can't block.
You may cast Gravecrawler from your graveyard as long as you control a Zombie.

cards.flavor:
"The Blessed Sleep? Ha! Wake up my lovelies, there's work to be done!"
—Gisa, ghoulcaller of Gavony
cards.name: Gravepurge
cards.text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Gruesome Discovery
cards.text:
Target player discards two cards.
Morbid — If a creature died this turn, instead that player reveals his or her hand, you choose two cards from it, then that player discards those cards.

cards.flavor:
"There are always fools who attempt to traverse Kruin Pass before sundown and every time they wind up in a race for their lives."
—Old Rutstein
cards.name: Harrowing Journey
cards.text: Target player draws three cards and loses 3 life.

cards.flavor:
"All the dead sleep lightly here, no matter how refined their beds may be."
—Grafdigger Wulmer
cards.name: Highborn Ghoul
cards.text: Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.name: Increasing Ambition
cards.text:
Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. If Increasing Ambition was cast from a graveyard, instead search your library for two cards and put those cards into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Flashback {7}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Mikaeus, the Unhallowed
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever a Human deals damage to you, destroy it.
Other non-Human creatures you control get +1/+1 and have undying. (When a creature with undying dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: His twisted words entice the weak.
cards.name: Ravenous Demon
cards.text: Sacrifice a Human: Transform Ravenous Demon. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: "The price is paid. The power is mine!"
cards.name: Archdemon of Greed
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a Human. If you can't, tap Archdemon of Greed and it deals 9 damage to you.

cards.flavor: The wreck hung on the jagged reef, each night disgorging more of its gruesome cargo.
cards.name: Reap the Seagraf
cards.text:
Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
Flashback {4}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: It blindly marches on Thraben's gates, guided by its master's direful will.
cards.name: Sightless Ghoul
cards.text:
Sightless Ghoul can't block.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Certain initiates into the Skirsdag cult take a vow of blindness, pledging obedience to none but demonkind.
cards.name: Skirsdag Flayer
cards.text: {3}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice a Human: Destroy target creature.

cards.flavor:
"Let us remind these human cattle why they fear the shadows of this world."
—Aldreg, Skirsdag cultist
cards.name: Spiteful Shadows
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to its controller.

cards.flavor: Linger on death's door and risk being invited in.
cards.name: Tragic Slip
cards.text:
Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
Morbid — That creature gets -13/-13 until end of turn instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Is it true the evil that people do follows them into death? Let's find out."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Undying Evil
cards.text: Target creature gains undying until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: He wields the full power of wrath unfettered by the sympathies of a soul.
cards.name: Vengeful Vampire
cards.text:
Flying
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Hers is an ancient form of necromancy, steeped in shamanic trance and ritual that few skaberen or ghoulcallers comprehend.
cards.name: Wakedancer
cards.text: Morbid — When Wakedancer enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"There will come a day so dark you will pray for death. On that day your prayers will be answered."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
cards.name: Zombie Apocalypse
cards.text: Return all Zombie creature cards from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped, then destroy all Humans.

cards.flavor: The rising of the first full moon eliminated any doubt as to the horrible truth lurking within.
cards.name: Afflicted Deserter
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Afflicted Deserter.

cards.name: Werewolf Ransacker
cards.text:
Whenever this creature transforms into Werewolf Ransacker, you may destroy target artifact. If that artifact is put into a graveyard this way, Werewolf Ransacker deals 3 damage to that artifact's controller.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Werewolf Ransacker.

cards.flavor: Being an alpha means proving it every full moon.
cards.name: Alpha Brawl
cards.text: Target creature an opponent controls deals damage equal to its power to each other creature that player controls, then each of those creatures deals damage equal to its power to that creature.

cards.flavor: Succession is a matter of blood, and by blood it is often decided.
cards.name: Blood Feud
cards.text: Target creature fights another target creature. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.flavor: Every now and then, a devil's prank can give you a good idea.
cards.name: Burning Oil
cards.text:
Burning Oil deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: It is the demon's mark, an infernal claim on the flesh of the guilty.
cards.name: Curse of Bloodletting
cards.text:
Enchant player
If a source would deal damage to enchanted player, it deals double that damage to that player instead.

cards.flavor: Savage vampires lurk in the Erdwal's network of passageways where prey is plentiful and easy to catch.
cards.name: Erdwal Ripper
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever Erdwal Ripper deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"
cards.name: Faithless Looting
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: "I drink of those who are worthy of my palate. The rest I burn."
cards.name: Fires of Undeath
cards.text:
Fires of Undeath deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {5}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Flayer of the Hatebound
cards.text:
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Flayer of the Hatebound or another creature enters the battlefield from your graveyard, that creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Masters of the sword know the blade is not the only weapon at their disposal.
cards.name: Fling
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fling, sacrifice a creature.
Fling deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Devils infiltrated the lower levels of Thraben Cathedral, making cracks in load-bearing pillars and setting fire to precious archives.
cards.name: Forge Devil
cards.text: When Forge Devil enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature and 1 damage to you.

cards.flavor: Their language may be a cacophonous agglomeration of chittering snorts and mad barking, but the message they send is all too clear.
cards.name: Heckling Fiends
cards.text: {2}{R}: Target creature attacks this turn if able.

cards.flavor:
"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.name: Hellrider
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.

cards.flavor: He tried to live far from those he could hurt . . .
cards.name: Hinterland Hermit
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hinterland Hermit.

cards.flavor: . . . but the monster within was a tireless hunter.
cards.name: Hinterland Scourge
cards.text:
Hinterland Scourge must be blocked if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Hinterland Scourge.

cards.name: Increasing Vengeance
cards.text:
Copy target instant or sorcery spell you control. If Increasing Vengeance was cast from a graveyard, copy that spell twice instead. You may choose new targets for the copies.
Flashback {3}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: "Mortals practice swordplay for a few decades at best. How can they ever attain the exquisite mastery that eternity has to offer?"
cards.name: Markov Blademaster
cards.text:
Double strike
Whenever Markov Blademaster deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: "What use is a stake or holy symbol in the hands of a coward?"
cards.name: Markov Warlord
cards.text:
Haste
When Markov Warlord enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: "Tovolar, my master. Gather the howlpack, for the Hunter's Moon is nigh and Thraben's walls grow weak."
cards.name: Mondronen Shaman
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mondronen Shaman.

cards.name: Tovolar's Magehunter
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, Tovolar's Magehunter deals 2 damage to that player.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Tovolar's Magehunter.

cards.flavor:
"Their hearts beat, their lungs draw breath, and they have one true form. I count them as allies of the living."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Moonveil Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Each creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Do not speak of this to the elders. They look unfavorably upon my indulgences."
cards.name: Nearheath Stalker
cards.text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Pyreheart Wolf
cards.text:
Whenever Pyreheart Wolf attacks, creatures you control gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.name: Russet Wolves

cards.flavor:
"Your fields will turn as black as a ghoul's tongue and fire shall be your only harvest."
—Minaldra, the Vizag Atum
cards.name: Scorch the Fields
cards.text: Destroy target land. Scorch the Fields deals 1 damage to each Human creature.

cards.flavor:
"You must shatter the fetters of the past. Only then can you truly act."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.name: Shattered Perception
cards.text:
Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
Flashback {5}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Talons of Falkenrath
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{1}{R}: This creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn."

cards.flavor: Devils redecorate every room with fire.
cards.name: Torch Fiend
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Torch Fiend: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: The skathul, spirits consumed by revenge, fester and seethe while looking for weak minds to assault.
cards.name: Wrack with Madness
cards.text: Target creature deals damage to itself equal to its power.

cards.flavor:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
cards.name: Briarpack Alpha
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Clinging Mists
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Fateful hour — If you have 5 or less life, tap all attacking creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor:
"Your veil's curse won't stop me, deathmage. I have taken down countless night hunters and this dark plane is not big enough for you to hide."
—Garruk Wildspeaker, to Liliana Vess
cards.name: Crushing Vines
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target creature with flying.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: Silent as winter snow, it seeks wild places unspoiled by the walking dead.
cards.name: Dawntreader Elk
cards.text: {G}, Sacrifice Dawntreader Elk: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Cast out by his village, he now takes grim offense at refugees who seek shelter in his forest.
cards.name: Deranged Outcast
cards.text: {1}{G}, Sacrifice a Human: Put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.

cards.flavor: Feeling abandoned by Avacyn, some Kessigers turned to the pagan rituals of their ancestors.
cards.name: Favor of the Woods
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature blocks, you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Feed the Pack
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you may sacrifice a nontoken creature. If you do, put X 2/2 green Wolf creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: It uproots entire fengrafs to add to its twisted frame.
cards.name: Ghoultree
cards.text: Ghoultree costs {1} less to cast for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: As the creatures of the night closed in on humanity, Innistrad's primeval forces stirred, as though waking to watch the slaughter.
cards.name: Gravetiller Wurm
cards.text:
Trample
Morbid — Gravetiller Wurm enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald
cards.name: Grim Flowering
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: In a world of monsters, it's the stuff of nightmares.
cards.name: Hollowhenge Beast

cards.flavor:
"Werewolves are an unholy mix of a predator's instinct and a human's hatred."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig
cards.name: Hunger of the Howlpack
cards.text:
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
Morbid — Put three +1/+1 counters on that creature instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Increasing Savagery
cards.text:
Put five +1/+1 counters on target creature. If Increasing Savagery was cast from a graveyard, put ten +1/+1 counters on that creature instead.
Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor: Its silk is highly prized, but then again, so is your life.
cards.name: Kessig Recluse
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor:
"Be wary of the seemingly gentle souls. The weak here were slaughtered long ago."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors
cards.name: Lambholt Elder
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Lambholt Elder.

cards.name: Silverpelt Werewolf
cards.text:
Whenever Silverpelt Werewolf deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Silverpelt Werewolf.

cards.name: Lost in the Woods
cards.text: Whenever a creature attacks you or a planeswalker you control, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Forest card, remove that creature from combat. Then put the revealed card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Predator Ooze
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Predator Ooze attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Predator Ooze this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Predator Ooze.

cards.flavor: "My village's fear drove me into the wild . . ."
cards.name: Scorned Villager
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Scorned Villager.

cards.flavor: ". . . and I will bring the fury of the wild back to my village."
cards.name: Moonscarred Werewolf
cards.text:
Vigilance
{T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Moonscarred Werewolf.

cards.flavor: The Somberwald is her domain, and she has yet to hear an acceptable excuse for trespassing.
cards.name: Somberwald Dryad
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: Geists of the hanged often haunt the tree on which they died.
cards.name: Strangleroot Geist
cards.text:
Haste
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Tracker's Instincts
cards.text:
Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put a creature card from among them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.flavor:
Out chasing bears
—Kessig expression meaning "died in the woods"
cards.name: Ulvenwald Bear
cards.text: Morbid — When Ulvenwald Bear enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature.

cards.flavor: As their villages fell to werewolves, fleeing refugees discovered they too had remarkable survival instincts.
cards.name: Village Survivors
cards.text:
Vigilance
Fateful hour — As long as you have 5 or less life, other creatures you control have vigilance.

cards.flavor:
"If you think you've killed one, guess again."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Vorapede
cards.text:
Vigilance, trample
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Otto the Hunter was filled with many grand ambitions. The snake was filled only with Otto.
cards.name: Wild Hunger
cards.text:
Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Wolfbitten Captive
cards.text:
{1}{G}: Wolfbitten Captive gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Wolfbitten Captive.

cards.name: Krallenhorde Killer
cards.text:
{3}{G}: Krallenhorde Killer gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Killer.

cards.flavor: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.
cards.name: Young Wolf
cards.text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Though its mind has long since rotted away, it wields a sword with deadly skill.
cards.name: Diregraf Captain
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever another Zombie you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: Dead or alive, true leaders can inspire an entire army.
cards.name: Drogskol Captain
cards.text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +1/+1 and have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: Wracked and warped with anguish, it obsessively seeks out other souls to hoard within its eternal prison.
cards.name: Drogskol Reaver
cards.text:
Flying, double strike, lifelink
Whenever you gain life, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "Your blood is quite pleasing. A pity there's not enough for both of us."
cards.name: Falkenrath Aristocrat
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Sacrifice a creature: Falkenrath Aristocrat gains indestructible until end of turn. If the sacrificed creature was a Human, put a +1/+1 counter on Falkenrath Aristocrat.

cards.flavor: Fusing intelligence with the power of undeath requires inspiration of the darkest kind.
cards.name: Havengul Lich
cards.text: {1}: You may cast target creature card in a graveyard this turn. When you cast that card this turn, Havengul Lich gains all activated abilities of that card until end of turn.

cards.name: Huntmaster of the Fells
cards.text:
Whenever this creature enters the battlefield or transforms into Huntmaster of the Fells, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield and you gain 2 life.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Huntmaster of the Fells.

cards.name: Ravager of the Fells
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever this creature transforms into Ravager of the Fells, it deals 2 damage to target opponent and 2 damage to up to one target creature that player controls.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ravager of the Fells.

cards.name: Immerwolf
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1.
Non-Human Werewolves you control can't transform.

cards.name: Sorin, Lord of Innistrad
cards.text:
+1: Put a 1/1 black Vampire creature token with lifelink onto the battlefield.
−2: You get an emblem with "Creatures you control get +1/+0."
−6: Destroy up to three target creatures and/or other planeswalkers. Return each card put into a graveyard this way to the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor:
"No longer can we allow our human populations to be mindlessly slaughtered by ghouls. Slay all who trespass."
—Runo Stromkirk
cards.name: Stromkirk Captain
cards.text:
First strike
Other Vampire creatures you control get +1/+1 and have first strike.

cards.name: Altar of the Lost
cards.text:
Altar of the Lost enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast spells with flashback from a graveyard.

cards.name: Avacyn's Collar

cards.flavor: The sweet taste of hope's promise.
cards.name: Chalice of Life
cards.text: {T}: You gain 1 life. Then if you have at least 10 life more than your starting life total, transform Chalice of Life.

cards.flavor: The bitter taste of life's only certainty.
cards.name: Chalice of Death
cards.text: {T}: Target player loses 5 life.

cards.flavor: Those who grasp its hilt soon hear the demon's call.
cards.name: Elbrus, the Binding Blade

cards.flavor: There are not enough lives on Innistrad to satisfy his thirst for retribution.
cards.name: Withengar Unbound
cards.text:
Flying, intimidate, trample (A creature with intimidate can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Whenever a player loses the game, put thirteen +1/+1 counters on Withengar Unbound.

cards.name: Executioner's Hood
cards.text:
Equipped creature has intimidate. (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
"If you wind up in one of mine, you can be sure as silver it will be your last."
—Grafdigger Wulmer
cards.name: Grafdigger's Cage
cards.text:
Creature cards can't enter the battlefield from graveyards or libraries.
Players can't cast cards in graveyards or libraries.

cards.name: Heavy Mattock
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1.
As long as equipped creature is a Human, it gets an additional +1/+1.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Helvault
cards.text:
{1}, {T}: Exile target creature you control.
{7}, {T}: Exile target creature you don't control.
When Helvault is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return all cards exiled with it to the battlefield under their owners' control.

cards.name: Jar of Eyeballs
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control dies, put two eyeball counters on Jar of Eyeballs.
{3}, {T}, Remove all eyeball counters from Jar of Eyeballs: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of eyeball counters removed this way. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Warden of the Wall
cards.text:
Warden of the Wall enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
As long as it's not your turn, Warden of the Wall is a 2/3 Gargoyle artifact creature with flying.

cards.flavor:
"Steel in the heart, silver in the bow."
—Wolfhunter's creed
cards.name: Wolfhunter's Quiver
cards.text:
Equipped creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player" and "{T}: This creature deals 3 damage to target Werewolf creature."
Equip {5}

cards.flavor:
"Our world is vast, but Thraben is its heart. The cathedral must stand even if the hinterlands are lost."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar
cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"I love what they've done with the place."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Grim Backwoods
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{B}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.

cards.flavor: A ghoulcaller's playground.
cards.name: Haunted Fengraf
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Haunted Fengraf: Return a creature card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"For centuries my creation kept this world in balance. Now only her shadow remains."
—Sorin Markov
cards.name: Vault of the Archangel
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{W}{B}, {T}: Creatures you control gain deathtouch and lifelink until end of turn.
